meanings.definition: relating to the arrangement or coordination of music for an orchestra
meanings.sent1: The orchestrational skills of the conductor were evident in the harmonious performance.
meanings.sent2: The orchestrational nuances in the symphony highlighted the composer's talent.
meanings.sent3: The orchestrational challenge of fitting all the instruments on stage was solved by rearranging the seating.
meanings.sent4: Her orchestrational abilities were like a painter carefully blending colors on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: The orchestrational precision of the musicians created a mesmerizing auditory experience.

meanings.definition: the act or process of organizing or arranging something in a coordinated manner
meanings.sent1: The orchestrational of the event required meticulous planning and coordination.
meanings.sent2: The orchestrational of the project ensured all tasks were completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The orchestrational of the party decorations turned the venue into a festive wonderland.
meanings.sent4: His orchestrational of the team members' roles was like a puzzle coming together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The orchestrational of the schedule made sure everything ran smoothly without any delays.
